resources.string:
PDF Redactor is an app that allows you to safely redact sensitive information in PDF documents.

Key Features:
• Load PDF files
• Mask text and image areas
• Save modified PDFs

Learn how to use the app through this guide.

To open a PDF file:

1. Tap the '+' button at the bottom right of the home screen.
2. Select a PDF file from your device.
3. Once the file is loaded, you'll be taken to the editor screen.

Recently worked projects are displayed as a list on the home screen.

First, click the masking toggle button at the bottom.

To mask sensitive information:

1. Touch the area on the PDF page you want to mask.
2. Drag your finger to draw the masking area.
3. When you lift your finger, the area will be covered in black.

You can mask multiple areas, and each area is managed individually.

When masking is complete, click the toggle button again to exit masking mode.

To navigate a multi-page PDF:

• Check the page number at the bottom of the screen.
• Use the left/right arrow buttons to move to the previous/next page.
• You can perform masking operations independently on each page.

After completing the masking work:

1. Tap the save button at the top.
2. The modified PDF will be saved to your device.
3. You can check the save location through system notifications.

The original file is not changed; it is saved as a new file.

If you need additional support:

• Check the version information in the app info.
• If you encounter problems, try restarting the app.
• To delete a project, tap the trash icon on the home screen.

For inquiries, please contact voll1212@gmail.com.

Thank you for using PDF Redactor!
